ReviewContent: I had complementary access to the mens spa since I was staying at the Cavallo Point Lodge for a couple of nights ($$$). When I checked in at the spa desk, everything seemed fine and I was shown the mens locker room entrance. But when I finally settled and got myself ready (after being frustrated with their non-functional lockers), I noticed that there was a sign on the door of the sauna that it was actually closed for repairs. No mention of this at all when I was at the front desk by staff nor on the front door of the locker room before I took the 10-15 minutes or so getting myself prepped. I get that things break every so often, but I found it bizarre that the staff would omit telling me that the thing I was specifically there for and wanted to use was non-functional before I even got past the meet and greet. After getting dressed and being very annoyed, I walked out and told the front desk about the closure. The gentleman at the desk then told me that its been broken for months and they have no idea when it would be fixed. Great. Thanks for the heads up. So if youre male, dont bother with the spa / sauna here. Despite hearing really good things about this place previously, I had a really disappointing visit and can not recommend this place with its current staff and amenities.
Metadata: {"GoogleName": "Cavallo Point Healing Arts Center & Spa", "PlaceID": "ChIJv41iByWEhYARcjKutw_eQh8", "ReviewIDHash": "ae9140f27f383d4a04f5751dd181a216", "OwnerResponseText": "", "OwnerResponseDate": NaN, "ReviewLikes": 0, "TotalReviews": 1.0, "LocalGuide": 0.0}

ReviewContent: I loved my massage. She was a great therapist. I was given a voucher for my Birthday and when I checked in I asked how much the massage was. Deep tissue was $240, I had a $250 voucher, so I said  that s great I have $10 left to spend in the shop! I was immediately reminded that gratuity was not included. After my message I went to settle up and I was told that they add 20% gratuity and included by $10 on my card so the bill was $48 on top of $240 massage! I was told they could change the tip amount manually if I wished. It did not sit right with me. Everywhere else allows you to enter your tip on the card machine. I felt ashamed to ask to leave less but had to as I am out of work at the moment and had a voucher. She had to cancel the transaction and do it again which made me feel like an inconvenience. Customers should NOT be made to feel guilty over gratuities and it was mentioned to me at check in. A 15-18.% gratuity should have been an option like everywhere else and made easy without feeling you have to leave  a 20% gratuity, all in all almost $300 for a 1  hour massage is just way  too expensive.
Metadata: {"GoogleName": "Cavallo Point Healing Arts Center & Spa", "PlaceID": "ChIJv41iByWEhYARcjKutw_eQh8", "ReviewIDHash": "e2754ea39621c015c7e21a5b1640bf2c", "OwnerResponseText": "", "OwnerResponseDate": NaN, "ReviewLikes": 0, "TotalReviews": 22.0, "LocalGuide": 1.0}

ReviewContent: We got 90 minutes massages. Our massage therapists were great and the massage was very relaxing. With taxes and a tip the staff had fixed, the massage cost an absurd $400 per person. This felt criminal considering how subpar the facilities were. The locker rooms were crowded and did not have enough showers. Considering how much nice massage spots in the area cost, this was overpriced by over $200 per massage. Do yourself a favor and avoid the Cavallo Point Spa.
Metadata: {"GoogleName": "Cavallo Point Healing Arts Center & Spa", "PlaceID": "ChIJv41iByWEhYARcjKutw_eQh8", "ReviewIDHash": "173751f85a1080bee8a777018ad64043", "OwnerResponseText": "", "OwnerResponseDate": NaN, "ReviewLikes": 0, "TotalReviews": 22.0, "LocalGuide": 0.0}

ReviewContent: My experience at this spa was difficult to articulate. The massage I received was a blend of different techniques, including Thai massage, Swedish, and Lomi Lomi. However, as a licensed massage practitioner, I found the combination of modalities in the 55-minute session to be overwhelming. Perhaps the 90-minute version would offer a better experience. While the practitioner was skilled, the flow of the massage felt disjointed. Additionally, the facilities were not well-maintained, with a band-aid in the outdoor hot tub, dust bunnies, and cobwebs in the lobby, and mediocre staff. Overall, the experience did not justify the high price, and I wouldnt consider returning unless the cost was significantly reduced.
Metadata: {"GoogleName": "Cavallo Point Healing Arts Center & Spa", "PlaceID": "ChIJv41iByWEhYARcjKutw_eQh8", "ReviewIDHash": "b97a764a8ee4f7af13bbb3f45176ca90", "OwnerResponseText": "", "OwnerResponseDate": NaN, "ReviewLikes": 1, "TotalReviews": 3.0, "LocalGuide": 0.0}

ReviewContent: The shop at the entrance and the waiting room are nice (although not super cozy). The complimentary hot herbal tea is tasty too. But the more important things are really not great. The locker/bathroom/jacuzzi area feels more like a public swimming pool/gym than a high end spa. The showers in particular were terrible. Massage was subpar. Too much talking, sound of the air purifier was louder than the music,  firm  pressure is too mild and no attention given to uncovered tension areas. It was maybe just bad luck, but the facilities are not nice enough to encourage to come back and give it another try.
Metadata: {"GoogleName": "Cavallo Point Healing Arts Center & Spa", "PlaceID": "ChIJv41iByWEhYARcjKutw_eQh8", "ReviewIDHash": "f210403248c19f9b37467d1aab5aad48", "OwnerResponseText": "", "OwnerResponseDate": NaN, "ReviewLikes": 0, "TotalReviews": 19.0, "LocalGuide": 0.0}

ReviewContent: Magic. Perfect gift. Amazing staff and place.
Metadata: {"GoogleName": "Cavallo Point Healing Arts Center & Spa", "PlaceID": "ChIJv41iByWEhYARcjKutw_eQh8", "ReviewIDHash": "3727f73c79750ed46ab29553085af157", "OwnerResponseText": "", "OwnerResponseDate": NaN, "ReviewLikes": 0, "TotalReviews": 79.0, "LocalGuide": 1.0}

ReviewContent: Awesome experience, it was a great pleasure to visit this resort!  Very friendly employees working there. Especially manager who was very helpful! That 2 hours of relaxation helped a lot during that cold weekend! Very cozy and relaxed atmosphere! Highly recommend to visit spa during your stay at that beautiful resort! Great view from fisher pier!
Metadata: {"GoogleName": "Cavallo Point Healing Arts Center & Spa", "PlaceID": "ChIJv41iByWEhYARcjKutw_eQh8", "ReviewIDHash": "ab5b617a3e522528ca7dde3d8e26494e", "OwnerResponseText": "", "OwnerResponseDate": NaN, "ReviewLikes": 0, "TotalReviews": 32.0, "LocalGuide": 1.0}

ReviewContent: I recently got my first facial at Cavallo Spa for my Birthday and I had an amazing Spa experience! The quality of the facial and products they used were beyond any Id had before. The staff was super gracious. The grounds are lovely and the Spa is clean with cozy fireplaces and views. From the steam room to outdoor jacuzzi..I really loved the warm outdoor pool! I will be back but I wont wait until my next Birthday!
Metadata: {"GoogleName": "Cavallo Point Healing Arts Center & Spa", "PlaceID": "ChIJv41iByWEhYARcjKutw_eQh8", "ReviewIDHash": "bac2666dec16f591a24939aa195d0c28", "OwnerResponseText": "", "OwnerResponseDate": NaN, "ReviewLikes": 1, "TotalReviews": 1.0, "LocalGuide": 0.0}

ReviewContent: This Spa is amazing! Had the most amazing facial with Tracy. The products are all high quality and super clean/organic. Spent time going in the pool, jacuzzi and the wet sauna before my treatment. You can also relax inside by the fire with a cup of tea. The grounds are well maintained and the locker rooms super clean. Overall a lovely, relaxing experience, highly recommend!
Metadata: {"GoogleName": "Cavallo Point Healing Arts Center & Spa", "PlaceID": "ChIJv41iByWEhYARcjKutw_eQh8", "ReviewIDHash": "895f8480644dc45e0fe338ad4f86cc1c", "OwnerResponseText": "", "OwnerResponseDate": NaN, "ReviewLikes": 0, "TotalReviews": 15.0, "LocalGuide": 0.0}

ReviewContent: Wanted to get a facial and relax and my esthetician talked the whole time. Said she wanted to educate me. There s was no massage and it simply wasn t relaxing. She also didn t pull any suggested products as she said she would. And at the end, I was forced to pay the 20% gratuity. I don t think I d return for a facial but the grounds were nice.
Metadata: {"GoogleName": "Cavallo Point Healing Arts Center & Spa", "PlaceID": "ChIJv41iByWEhYARcjKutw_eQh8", "ReviewIDHash": "3afe21594e1f2723093bd8420dcd3767", "OwnerResponseText": "", "OwnerResponseDate": NaN, "ReviewLikes": 1, "TotalReviews": 6.0, "LocalGuide": 0.0}

ReviewContent: Excellent massage therapists. (5 Stars) Overpriced.
Metadata: {"GoogleName": "Cavallo Point Healing Arts Center & Spa", "PlaceID": "ChIJv41iByWEhYARcjKutw_eQh8", "ReviewIDHash": "bd6613a0d5f724f2787169656ab640c7", "OwnerResponseText": "", "OwnerResponseDate": NaN, "ReviewLikes": 0, "TotalReviews": 9.0, "LocalGuide": 0.0}

ReviewContent: Best prenatal massage in the city! One of the few places that allows you to lay on your stomach with their belly pillows. The mineral pool outside is perfect for floating before or after and the tea bar is beautiful. Making this my monthly mama ritual!
Metadata: {"GoogleName": "Cavallo Point Healing Arts Center & Spa", "PlaceID": "ChIJv41iByWEhYARcjKutw_eQh8", "ReviewIDHash": "f7db006c4c5a43e02ecb79d9a2faa86c", "OwnerResponseText": "", "OwnerResponseDate": NaN, "ReviewLikes": 1, "TotalReviews": 26.0, "LocalGuide": 0.0}

ReviewContent: Horrible customer experience. Called for a same day appt and the receptionist booked it incorrectly. Zero help from management. So not worth the hike. God I miss Nob Hill Spa - I would never have bothered with this place if they were still open I will never call here again. What a waste of my time.
Metadata: {"GoogleName": "Cavallo Point Healing Arts Center & Spa", "PlaceID": "ChIJv41iByWEhYARcjKutw_eQh8", "ReviewIDHash": "5cc2a9d034443709eec3a78a7ddc3fad", "OwnerResponseText": "", "OwnerResponseDate": NaN, "ReviewLikes": 0, "TotalReviews": 10.0, "LocalGuide": 0.0}

ReviewContent: I got a head and scalp massage here that was the worst massage I ve ever had in my life. My masseuse was extremely rough and pulled lots of my hair out during the session. I was still finding clumps of hair falling out when I took a shower afterwards. The whole experience was super painful and my scalp now feels like it s on fire (not in a good way).  What s worse is that my masseuse never even asked me how I felt during the treatment. After 20mins of pain I had to just tell her to stop the massage. The way this masseuse handled my body was like she was roughhousing a slab of meat. There s definitely no quality control at this spa and it s embarrassing.
Metadata: {"GoogleName": "Cavallo Point Healing Arts Center & Spa", "PlaceID": "ChIJv41iByWEhYARcjKutw_eQh8", "ReviewIDHash": "6bc3adb3176e392c4745084320619f04", "OwnerResponseText": "", "OwnerResponseDate": NaN, "ReviewLikes": 1, "TotalReviews": 6.0, "LocalGuide": 0.0}

ReviewContent: Love everything about the Cavallo Point spa. Treatments are wonderful and the ambiance is truly magical. It s a perfect escape from the city.
Metadata: {"GoogleName": "Cavallo Point Healing Arts Center & Spa", "PlaceID": "ChIJv41iByWEhYARcjKutw_eQh8", "ReviewIDHash": "46980ce53c607941ac2481c95c945b62", "OwnerResponseText": "", "OwnerResponseDate": NaN, "ReviewLikes": 0, "TotalReviews": 14.0, "LocalGuide": 0.0}

ReviewContent: Ive been to so many spas, this one was like no other. They had so many amenities after my deep tissue massage. Customer service was amazing. The place is so zen and calm. They have a tea bar which you can sip near the meditation pool as you sun bathe. Perfect zones to relax outside. Theres a steam room and jacuzzi in the bathrooms where you can zone out completely. The bathrooms were clean, with many towels and accessories you need to hair dry yourself, combs, lotions, sprays, etc. I would recommend it to couples seeking some time together or for anybody looking to treat themselves after a long day.
Metadata: {"GoogleName": "Cavallo Point Healing Arts Center & Spa", "PlaceID": "ChIJv41iByWEhYARcjKutw_eQh8", "ReviewIDHash": "9c7982e1b4132d2ddcf11a08749b950e", "OwnerResponseText": "", "OwnerResponseDate": NaN, "ReviewLikes": 1, "TotalReviews": 7.0, "LocalGuide": 0.0}

ReviewContent: Great massage followed by steam room and hot tub. Very nice facility and staff was awesome.
Metadata: {"GoogleName": "Cavallo Point Healing Arts Center & Spa", "PlaceID": "ChIJv41iByWEhYARcjKutw_eQh8", "ReviewIDHash": "ea7bc47bec6c901994b229eed332be06", "OwnerResponseText": "", "OwnerResponseDate": NaN, "ReviewLikes": 0, "TotalReviews": 212.0, "LocalGuide": 1.0}

ReviewContent: The environment is beautiful, massage therapist whom I like was out that day. The one I got was ok. Front desk had a learning curve for sure
Metadata: {"GoogleName": "Cavallo Point Healing Arts Center & Spa", "PlaceID": "ChIJv41iByWEhYARcjKutw_eQh8", "ReviewIDHash": "63aa457a83230593b42036d69784cbf4", "OwnerResponseText": "", "OwnerResponseDate": NaN, "ReviewLikes": 0, "TotalReviews": 5.0, "LocalGuide": 0.0}

ReviewContent: I got a prenatal massage here this weekend. The experience with the masseuse and the amenities were wonderful, except for one issue that happened later. During my morning spa appointment I noticed the complimentary tea being served wasn t pregnancy safe. I asked the staff if there was another option and was offered a tea of my choice. The spa  called me 10 hours later while I was at dinner with family asking for me to  settle up  my payment for the tea. As someone that spent $350+ there earlier in the day, it felt pretty money-hungry and inappropriate. Hope customer service situations like this can be addressed with front staff moving forward.
Metadata: {"GoogleName": "Cavallo Point Healing Arts Center & Spa", "PlaceID": "ChIJv41iByWEhYARcjKutw_eQh8", "ReviewIDHash": "012ed160db67c09c2433df845f5a52af", "OwnerResponseText": "", "OwnerResponseDate": NaN, "ReviewLikes": 3, "TotalReviews": 3.0, "LocalGuide": 0.0}

ReviewContent: Great spa experience. Get there early to enjoy the relaxing ambiance!

ReviewContent: Quiet and peaceful location just a few minutes from the city. We had a great afternoon and we will return.
Metadata: {"GoogleName": "Cavallo Point Healing Arts Center & Spa", "PlaceID": "ChIJv41iByWEhYARcjKutw_eQh8", "ReviewIDHash": "37a40b5e9c2e6db8cd8685df7a16d773", "OwnerResponseText": "", "OwnerResponseDate": NaN, "ReviewLikes": 0, "TotalReviews": 230.0, "LocalGuide": 1.0}

ReviewContent: Took my BAE there after she graduated from law school. Couples massage was good. Sauna was hot. Meditation pool was THE BOMB! It s like 4 feet deep maybe a little more, about 90 degrees maybe a little more, quiet and relaxing. Just semi-float and relax, while watching the fog roll in overhead. I mos def want to go back. If you choose to give a thumbs-up    or not, I hope you found my review helpful!
Metadata: {"GoogleName": "Cavallo Point Healing Arts Center & Spa", "PlaceID": "ChIJv41iByWEhYARcjKutw_eQh8", "ReviewIDHash": "e8b3d28c3622fcfcd5e01be02cf6c2d4", "OwnerResponseText": "", "OwnerResponseDate": NaN, "ReviewLikes": 2, "TotalReviews": 113.0, "LocalGuide": 1.0}

ReviewContent: I spent Super Bowl Sunday there last year with my friend LNel. We had the large lawn almost to ourselves. Had a wonderful picnic, and visited the Spas Gift Shop. I was so tempted to buy the cute hats they had there! I actually love both gift shops and the Gallery.
Metadata: {"GoogleName": "Cavallo Point Healing Arts Center & Spa", "PlaceID": "ChIJv41iByWEhYARcjKutw_eQh8", "ReviewIDHash": "7a365a8d47a095c5dcfd28853614070a", "OwnerResponseText": "", "OwnerResponseDate": NaN, "ReviewLikes": 0, "TotalReviews": 11.0, "LocalGuide": 1.0}

ReviewContent: I like it here, I feel welcomed and the staff is fully attentive - its a special place I wouldnt hesitate bringing a loved one too. One caution, it gets super crowded on holidays and evenings- for this reason Ill only be booking mornings going forward:)
Metadata: {"GoogleName": "Cavallo Point Healing Arts Center & Spa", "PlaceID": "ChIJv41iByWEhYARcjKutw_eQh8", "ReviewIDHash": "edd93406d477214d122cb2555dc33fa5", "OwnerResponseText": "", "OwnerResponseDate": NaN, "ReviewLikes": 0, "TotalReviews": 83.0, "LocalGuide": 0.0}

ReviewContent: I went to Cavallo spa to celebrate a birthday. It was absolutely stunning and felt like you were in a forest, not 10min outside of SF.  They have private hot tubs for the mens and womens locker room and a co-ed heated pool. I got the original message and it was worth every penny. They have free parking. Only complaint would be that the spa address is not the actual location on their property (atleast according to maps) so our group got a little lost. Its located about 2 blocks away from the actual hotel lobby. Overall highly recommend and I will be returning.
Metadata: {"GoogleName": "Cavallo Point Healing Arts Center & Spa", "PlaceID": "ChIJv41iByWEhYARcjKutw_eQh8", "ReviewIDHash": "7d70cbdd033d9e101ec64bd2c31c33a1", "OwnerResponseText": "", "OwnerResponseDate": NaN, "ReviewLikes": 1, "TotalReviews": 147.0, "LocalGuide": 1.0}

ReviewContent: Such a lovely retreat from the noise of the city. An oasis, really. Ordering food and relaxing by the pool after massages is the way to go!
Metadata: {"GoogleName": "Cavallo Point Healing Arts Center & Spa", "PlaceID": "ChIJv41iByWEhYARcjKutw_eQh8", "ReviewIDHash": "ec5df46732cb085fc2de19ff3bf2f231", "OwnerResponseText": "", "OwnerResponseDate": NaN, "ReviewLikes": 0, "TotalReviews": 54.0, "LocalGuide": 1.0}

ReviewContent: Who am I? Queen of the Nile? When I die, Ill be disappointed if heaven isnt THIS SPA. This is the spa you think of when you imagine the best case scenario. The expectation matches the reality. Now go pretend youre a goddess for a couple hours.
Metadata: {"GoogleName": "Cavallo Point Healing Arts Center & Spa", "PlaceID": "ChIJv41iByWEhYARcjKutw_eQh8", "ReviewIDHash": "4d1cf8862ed207e3a559b11e42a735d7", "OwnerResponseText": "", "OwnerResponseDate": NaN, "ReviewLikes": 0, "TotalReviews": 8.0, "LocalGuide": 0.0}

ReviewContent: Elegant space and nicely appointed amenities. Personal bummers were loud guests at outdoor meditation pool, and general untidiness at pool (every chaise had soiled towels and drink ware at every lounge :( Womens space was fine and mostly well attended to but hair in drains, steam room stale-but my resourceful self found the eucalyptus oil in attendant closet when no attendant could be found (waited 10 ). Womens Jacuzzi was perfection with both temperature and jets. Lots of spa water and cucumber washcloths which were a refreshing relief. My massage was a good old fashioned elbow centric Swedish. I just assumed they were 50  hours but my gf s came out 10-15 minutes later so I clarified, and I was indeed shorted 10 minutes. Ok all and all but doesn t leave a patron with a  good taste . The environs make up for a lot assuming you re there in a day with polite spa fellows who keep their conversation volumes down and clean up their own drain hairs.
Metadata: {"GoogleName": "Cavallo Point Healing Arts Center & Spa", "PlaceID": "ChIJv41iByWEhYARcjKutw_eQh8", "ReviewIDHash": "f9ac6c64dfbf2a07551ec2298bc1346f", "OwnerResponseText": "", "OwnerResponseDate": NaN, "ReviewLikes": 3, "TotalReviews": 4.0, "LocalGuide": 0.0}

ReviewContent: I had my very first massage here. I had the wonderful Kelli, and the specialty massage. She was extremely nice, considerate, and professional. I chatted her ear off and she held my level the whole time. 10 stars if I could.
Metadata: {"GoogleName": "Cavallo Point Healing Arts Center & Spa", "PlaceID": "ChIJv41iByWEhYARcjKutw_eQh8", "ReviewIDHash": "893bf69962574c3f498b0ff10746f5e7", "OwnerResponseText": "", "OwnerResponseDate": NaN, "ReviewLikes": 0, "TotalReviews": 12.0, "LocalGuide": 0.0}

ReviewContent: I love coming to this quiet oasis. I drive all the way from Oakland for a peaceful respite from busy Mom life. I m addition to the expert massages, I come for Reiki treatments with Frances. Her caring, gentle insights have helped me through some difficult times in my life. It s always a treat to spend some time at the spa, spa pool, and enjoy lunch at the Tea Garden!
Metadata: {"GoogleName": "Cavallo Point Healing Arts Center & Spa", "PlaceID": "ChIJv41iByWEhYARcjKutw_eQh8", "ReviewIDHash": "e4fc5918e2365a28eb638657aaf7fb7d", "OwnerResponseText": "", "OwnerResponseDate": NaN, "ReviewLikes": 0, "TotalReviews": 7.0, "LocalGuide": 0.0}

ReviewContent: Always life reaffirming!!!

ReviewContent: Gorgeous! And everyone on staff was lovely and helpful.

ReviewContent: Very calming atmosphere, spa, sauna and outdoor space with chairs. I had an Organic Massage and the masseuse was amazing. Perfect pressure, no talking and she worked out some knots from stress. Highly recommend this spa. After the massage I sat in an Adirondack Chair under the Eucalyptus trees enjoying the fresh air before getting in my car.
Metadata: {"GoogleName": "Cavallo Point Healing Arts Center & Spa", "PlaceID": "ChIJv41iByWEhYARcjKutw_eQh8", "ReviewIDHash": "0e96482e451962d14951416ded7fab4c", "OwnerResponseText": "", "OwnerResponseDate": NaN, "ReviewLikes": 0, "TotalReviews": 39.0, "LocalGuide": 1.0}

ReviewContent: very clam and relaxing atmosphere great massage

ReviewContent: Best therapists in the area.

ReviewContent: Great massages

ReviewContent: Beautiful spa oasis not far from the city. Spa pool is amazing (heated) and the tea bar has so many delicious options. Could have spent all day here!
Metadata: {"GoogleName": "Cavallo Point Healing Arts Center & Spa", "PlaceID": "ChIJv41iByWEhYARcjKutw_eQh8", "ReviewIDHash": "83466af9c883420b86a5f2d0fabb641a", "OwnerResponseText": "", "OwnerResponseDate": NaN, "ReviewLikes": 3, "TotalReviews": 28.0, "LocalGuide": 1.0}

ReviewContent: One of the worst facials Ive ever had. The aestheticians did not seem to know what she was doing. She did a very poor extraction on a portion of my nose when I specifically asked for extraction since I booked it. My face does not feel clean at all. I didnt get any insightful information about my skin and felt like my face and neck werent properly cleaned between products. The room we were in was bright and a bit cold, there was a loud sink in the room which made it hard to fully relax. The facility is beautiful and I really wanted to like the service too. Im definitely not going back.
Metadata: {"GoogleName": "Cavallo Point Healing Arts Center & Spa", "PlaceID": "ChIJv41iByWEhYARcjKutw_eQh8", "ReviewIDHash": "5810002baf3f8a2cd7f789157c1cf8e6", "OwnerResponseText": "", "OwnerResponseDate": NaN, "ReviewLikes": 3, "TotalReviews": 6.0, "LocalGuide": 0.0}

ReviewContent: My wife and I came here for a couples massage for our wedding anniversary and were somewhat unimpressed. Her massage was good, but mine felt clumsy, rough, uncoordinated, and not very relaxing. The total for the couples massage was $370, which seems quite overpriced when Ive gotten better massages for far less. And when I wanted to tip my massage therapist less than my wifes, the clerk at the front desk seemed to turn sour and unfriendly on me. We also had access to the heated pool, hot tub, and other spa areas. The pool was in a pretty setting, but there were leaves, dead bugs, and a sheen of oil floating on top. The hot tub was very small and the glass tiling around it had unsightly mold growing under it. The locker room was very nice, though, with good skin care regimens available as well as a nice steam room. Overall, though, this place was not worth the price. At all.
Metadata: {"GoogleName": "Cavallo Point Healing Arts Center & Spa", "PlaceID": "ChIJv41iByWEhYARcjKutw_eQh8", "ReviewIDHash": "d3f8f3b119917aae88ff92e02e5d4a43", "OwnerResponseText": "", "OwnerResponseDate": NaN, "ReviewLikes": 7, "TotalReviews": 10.0, "LocalGuide": 0.0}

ReviewContent: Really wanted to like this place!  Ive been to a lot of spas, but was super excited to try this one.  There are some really good points, but the negatives are too much for me to return.  Overall it felt like a high volume place, where people cycle in and out on que. Pros:  Staff is very friend, massage was good and masseuse very communicative.  Overall location is great and the seating area is very large and open.  As per all spas, they serve flavored water and hot tea.  The steam room was good, but again, small - maybe 4 people could fit without being crowded - see below....... Cons:  Crowded!!!  All the massages begin/end at the same time, so the locker room is filled with the next group, or those that just finished.  And its a small locker room, so about 8 ladies are all changing next to each other.  Only 2 showers.  Outdoor jacuzzi is small and can only hold 4 people comfortably.  The outdoor pool is also small with a lot of loungers surrounding the pool.  Maybe 6 people could be there; 8 would be crowded.  No reading material in the seating area - very odd for a spa. At the end of your massage, you exit your room, where all the masseuses are outside their room, waiting with a glass of water in their hand for their client to exit. This felt too commercial, high volume and not relaxing.  The area is beautiful, but too many people.

ReviewContent: The beautiful setting enhances your experience at this spa. If you buy one of the multiple treatments available, you get access to their single-sex steam room and whirlpool, both of which are clothing optional, as well as the co-ed (swim suit/trunks needed) 100 degree (!) meditation pool.  All spa products, hair dryers etc are provided. You can also relax in the lounge or in their outdoor area which has chairs, tables and fire pits. If youre hungry, you can order food from their restaurant or purchase a variety of juices from the spa juice bar. Its a wonderful place to spend a few hours or a day, so close to the city, while still giving you the feeling of being away from it all.
